stream_context.summary: Kaze spent most of the stream coding and play-testing a new "cowboy" mine-cart set-piece for Return to Yoshi’s Island.  He imported Biobak’s latest graphics, adjusted camera and physics code, replaced several Mario voice clips, and discussed overall star/coin design.

development_findings.summary: Kaze has worked "the last week or two" importing Biobak’s objects and building a new cowboy-themed cave where Snifits flee in mine-carts and the player pursues on a larger cart.
development_findings.quote: I spent the last two weeks working on this level here importing Biobak’s things and I think it looks pretty good.

development_findings.summary: Red-coin stars now keep the player in-level; Kaze considers it a "necessary change" but can’t do it for every star because linear sections still need a warp back.
development_findings.quote: I also made it so that red coin stars don’t put you out of the stage anymore… but that is a very limiting design thing for linear sections.

development_findings.summary: 100-coin stars are being cut; a single global coin counter will replace them.
development_findings.quote: There’s no 100-coin stars in this game… there will be a global coin counter basically.

development_findings.summary: Trying vertex-lighting (polys) for the cave but visual quality was poor, so he kept textured lighting.
development_findings.quote: It’d be cheaper to use polys instead of a texture for lighting… I actually tried it but I couldn’t make it look good.

development_findings.summary: Added a camera-entry function that forces a custom angle when the level loads.
development_findings.quote: There’s actually a cool feature in my engine here that allows you to set the camera angle on level entry.

development_findings.summary: Mine-cart sequence problems: three small carts made jumping too hard; pivoted to one large cart for Mario, faster outer carts for Snifits, and a short intro cut-scene to prevent unfair deaths.
development_findings.quote: Swapping between mine-carts is really, really difficult… what if instead of three small ones there’s just one big one that you can walk around on?

development_findings.summary: Discovered camera flag bug (keep-behind flag treated as index ‘3’) and patched it.
development_findings.quote: I feel like there is a bug with the camera code… when we have both on they actually turn into ‘3’ and ‘3’ means it can always go through.

development_findings.summary: Several new sound effects added: ground-pound (MK64), spin-jump (Smash Melee), and a pitched-down fall yell; still tuning pitch and length.
development_findings.quote: I just realised… here are the new sounds, I want your opinion on these.

context_findings.summary: Kaze sees house-cleaning as wasted time; in Germany he hired a cleaner.
context_findings.quote: Maybe that’s why I shouldn’t clean… when I lived in Germany I just had a cleaning lady.

context_findings.summary: His PayPal funds are locked to storefront spending; he’s looking for work-arounds and joked about CSGO skins.
context_findings.quote: PayPal refused to let me use my PayPal money… anyone got an idea what I should do with that?

context_findings.summary: Considering a social-media manager to chase Twitter monetisation (needs 5 M impressions).
context_findings.quote: I’m thinking we need to go all out on Twitter… I should hire a social media manager.

context_findings.summary: Expressed distrust of modern doctors after poor experiences with elbow and wrist injuries; prefers physiotherapy/self-research.
context_findings.quote: Every time I went to a doctor recently it’s just been worse for me… physiotherapy solved the problem instead of cortisol.

context_findings.summary: Advocates analogue-stick depth and laments modern games that ignore it.
context_findings.quote: They invented this in 1996 and there are still games out in 2023 that don’t use this.

biobak.summary: Provided new cowboy-level assets that Kaze spent up to two weeks importing.

zeina.summary: Asked to model milk-bottles for the level’s saloon theme.
zeina.quote: Zeina, you make milk bottles. I need them.

zeina.summary: Generated loud furnace/oven noises upstairs during stream; playful back-and-forth indicates informal home-studio dynamic.
zeina.quote: Oh my god, Zeina, shut up… what is that ungodly noise?

key_stories.title: Mine-Cart Pivot
key_stories.summary: Initial design used three parallel mine-carts for both Mario and Snifits, but testing showed the jumps were too punishing.  After multiple path-speed tweaks, Kaze replaced Mario’s cart with a single wide platform cart, added a cut-scene so players can’t pre-empt the sequence, and adjusted camera flags.
key_stories.challenge: Jumping between three small carts felt unfair and caused camera clipping.
key_stories.process: Tweaked path speeds, experimented with alignment code, then decided on one large cart plus intro cut-scene; fixed camera flag bug.
key_stories.outcome: Sequence now plays smoothly; next steps are Snifit shooting logic and fall-through pit ending.
key_stories.key_quote: Swapping between mine-carts is really, really difficult… what if instead of three small ones there’s just one big one that you can walk around on?

key_stories.title: Sound Overhaul Mini-Project
key_stories.summary: Kaze replaced several core Mario SFX with samples from Mario Kart 64 and Smash Melee, soliciting chat feedback on pitch and length.
key_stories.challenge: Standard SM64 sounds felt dated or mismatched with new mechanics (ground-pound jump, spin-jump, falling).
key_stories.process: Imported samples, adjusted pitch, tested in-game, noted issues (too high-pitched, clipped).
key_stories.outcome: Final choices mostly liked by chat but marked ‘still improvable’.
key_stories.key_quote: I just realised… here are the new sounds, I want your opinion on these.

key_stories.title: Red-Coin Star Design Shift
key_stories.summary: Classic SM64 red-coin stars ejected players; Kaze removed the ejection to keep flow but must retain it for linear sections.
key_stories.challenge: SM64 behaviour disrupts pacing; fully removing ejection would break linear areas.
key_stories.process: Flagged only red-coin stars as non-eject, discussed pros/cons on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Hybrid system: red-coin stars stay in-level, others mostly eject.
key_stories.key_quote: I think it’d be nice to have a Mario game where stuff like that doesn’t boot you out at all… but that is very limiting.

open_questions.context: Kaze said 100-coin stars are gone and a "global coin counter" will replace them but gave no implementation details.
questions: How will the global coin counter tie into rewards or progression?
Will coins persist across deaths and levels?
Does this change impact level economy and enemy placement?

open_questions.context: Kaze asked Zeina to create milk-bottle models for the cowboy level; no follow-up shown.
questions: What style and purpose will the milk bottles serve (decoration vs. interactive)?
Any challenges in animating glass on N64 hardware?

open_questions.context: A keep-camera flag turned into index ‘3’, letting the camera clip; Kaze patched it quickly.
questions: Was this a one-off typo or a systemic engine issue?
Will other levels need auditing for the same flag misuse?

open_questions.context: New SFX added but Kaze admits they need ‘a bit of improvement’.
questions: What criteria decide final sound approval?
